interests.name: Applied (Industrial) experience
keywords: Computational Pathology (Cell Detection, Tissue Segmentation, Sub-cell Models)

interests.name: Research (Academic) experience
keywords: Generative Models (Diffusion-based, Bridging, CTMs, and GANs)
Super-Resolution (using RNNs for Event-cameras, using weighted patches for Facial images)

work.name: Medical Imaging and Signal Processing Research Center - Medical University of Isfahan, Iran.
highlights: Developed data clustering and purification pipelines, semi-automated data labeling systems, deep learning models, and analysis software.

Conducted AI jump-start courses for university professors and medical experts, tailored to various branches of medicine. These courses aimed to foster interdisciplinary research teams focused on AI research and application design, while also providing support grants.
Designed university curricula for teaching AI applications in Ophthalmology and Dentistry, and actively participated in teaching the Ophthalmology curriculum.
Collaborated across multiple disciplines, including general medicine, pathology, dentistry, ophthalmology, pharmacy, and neuroscience.
Implemented computational infrastructure for online and remote training programs.

work.name: Researcher - Seoul National University - Machine Perception and Reasoning lab.
highlights: mentoring two MS students
Project 1 - Depth estimation with Event Cameras using Spiking Neural Networks
Project 2 - Image-to-image Translation with Diffusion Models
Paper contributions (submission to CVPR'25|ICML'25).

work.name: Oncology Model-Centric AI Research - Lunit Inc., South Korea.
work.position: (Senior) Research Scientist and Team leader - 3 yrs
highlights: Led a team of 3~4 members.
Improved performance of SCOPE‚Ñ¢ products and pharma-requested models/bakeoffs.
Developed CV/ML-based cell detection and tissue segmentation models for SCOPE‚Ñ¢ (IO, PD-L1, HER2), and UIHC.
Lead taskforces in 4 out of 8 model development sprints.
Developing further product-oriented research directions e.g. Universal IHC models [A1], Sub-cellular models [P1], WSI synthesis, and End-point mutations.
Shared recent CV/ML trends through study groups, weekly research seminars, and yearly department-wise seminars.
Published findings,  practices, and resources in Computational Pathology and PathOmics, including Abstracts [A1~A4], Journals [J3, J4], Patents [P1], and Challenges [S3].
Collaborated across desciplines of pathology, biomedical engineering, product engineering, and business development.

work.name: GIST Comp. Vis. lab, KAIST Vis. Intel. lab, South Korea.
work.summary: RA at GIST (2015~2021), RA at KAIST (2017~2019).
highlights: Proposed novel deep-learning approaches on the event-based vision for image reconstruction [J1, C3], super-resolution [J2, C4], and depth estimation [C1, C2].
Published in top-tier journals (TPAMI/IJCV [J1, J2]), conferences (CVPR/IJCV [C1~C4] - 1 oral), and registered a Patent [P2].
Mentored a master's student, from teaching basic concepts to publishing in a CVPR paper [C1].
Ranked #1 in CVPRW Event-based Vision Competition (2021).

Contributed to the research community by releasing 2 code repos on GitHub from papers: https://github.com/gistvision/e2sri (50‚≠ê)[C3] (June 2024), https://github.com/yonseivnl/se-cff (37‚≠ê)[C1] (June 2024).

work.name: Miscellaneous Academic and Industrial positions
highlights: Instrumentation supervisor - Esfahan Petrochemical Company (Spring 2013 - Fall 2015).
Researcher - Isfahan University of Technology (Fall 2012 - Spring 2013), Subsea R&D center.
Instructor - Islamic Azad University, Mobarakeh Branch (2011 and 2013).

education.institution: GIST - Gwangju Institute of Science and Technology.
courses: Recieved the Presidential Excellence Award for my Dissertation.
Dissertation title: 'Event-based vision: Image reconstruction, Super-resolution, Depth estimation'.
Advisor: Prof. Jonghyun Choi (GIST - now at SNU).
Thesis title: 'Facial Image Super-Resolution Using Weighted Patch Pairs'.
Advisor: Prof. Javad Haddadnia (Hakim Sabzevari University)
Co-Advisor: Prof. Payman Moallem (University of Esfahan).
